content:
Based on the execution logs, I'll generate a report summarizing the structures and error tips:

EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Plate Production Facility
Consists of three stone furnaces in a production line:
- Furnace 1 at position (0.0, 0.0)
- Furnace 2 at position (2.0, 0.0)
- Furnace 3 at position (4.0, 4.0)
All furnaces are actively working, processing copper ore into copper plates

### Copper Cable Assembly Line
Located around position (9.5, 11.5), consists of:
- Assembling machine for producing copper cable
- Input chest at (6.5, 11.5) containing iron plates
- Burner inserter at (7.5, 11.5) moving items from input chest to assembler
- Output burner inserter at (11.5, 11.5) 
- Output storage chest at (12.5, 11.5) containing mixed resources

### Storage Area
Multiple chests for resource storage:
- Chest at (14.5, 11.5) storing iron plates (full)
- Chest at (16.5, 11.5) storing copper plates
- Science pack storage chest at (0.5, 31.5) containing automation and logistic science packs

### Power Generation System
Located around position (-7.0, 24.5), consists of:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5) producing water
- Pipe network connecting pump to boiler
- Boiler at (-7.0, 24.5)
- Steam engine at (-2.5, 24.5)
- Connected electric pole network distributing power

### Research Facility
- Multiple labs connected to the power grid
- Burner inserter at (0.5, 30.5) feeding science packs to labs
- Labs configured for automation and logistic science research

ERROR TIPS

### Resource Shortage Errors
- Ensure sufficient coal is available before attempting to insert into boilers and furnaces
- Keep track of coal inventory to maintain continuous power generation

### Production Errors
- The copper cable assembling machine shows ingredient shortages - ensure consistent supply of copper plates
- Monitor assembler output and only attempt extraction when products are available

### Power System Issues
- Boiler shows "out of fuel" warning - maintain consistent coal supply to avoid power interruptions
- Monitor steam and water levels in the power generation system
